title: Youngrebel
author: Youngrebel
created_time: March 22, 2025, 09:31:36 PMLast edit: March 24, 2025, 12:08:51 AM by Youngrebel
content: A significant milestone for Bitcoin from 2009 to date. And many mining companies mined it. AntPool received $275,500 for mining it. source This is another milestone for the Bitcoin ecosystem for Bitcoin hitting block 888,888. The adoption of Bitcoin rising day and night and with that the mining also increase and today it has hit it thousands and now it is going to the millions. And it is very closed to the million and before the next halving Bitcoin will be mined 1,000,000 plus. This shows the progressive nature of bitcoin and it decentralized nature.

comments.author: Catenaccio
comments.body: Sometimes to celebrate something or an anniversary of important milestone in Bitcoin history, Bitcoin mining pool that finds a block adds special message in the block's Coinbase message.This block has no special Coinbase message, but this block has a cool block ID number, and that's all.Quote from: https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/block/888888Coinbase data� Mined by AntPool � �W(��mm��W�Y�[ pX/�*&quot;}�ޱyN���V���&gt;ڊ$�&#039;�

comments.author: DiMarxist
comments.body: This needs to be celebrated. Op I don't have merit I would have given some like the eight figure of all the eights as the first commenter did. This is a real milestone Bitcoin has come far and it is still continues. This day should not be forgotten and the day when the blocks will hit 1000000 will be an another milestone to achieve. As the Op Said, now that Bitcoin has hit 888888 blocks, then 2028 halving, Bitcoin will be 1 million plus because the number is very close now.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Thank God (as a person who transacts in Bitcoin and not as a miner  ) the inscription madness died down sometime back. I am pretty sure the optimal mining fees who be high up there even after the block had already been mined due to the ripple effect of mempool congestion, or maybe they are waiting for the last block before having and first block after having?

comments.author: EFS
comments.body: That's definitely a good milestone but more impressive would be block number 1 million. Considering that a block is found approximately every 10 minutes, some simple calculations suggest that this could happen around 2027. Don't forget to tag me when we witness this historic moment in two years.

comments.author: Youngrebel
comments.body: Quote from: EFS on March 23, 2025, 10:08:43 PMThat's definitely a good milestone but more impressive would be block number 1 million. Considering that a block is found approximately every 10 minutes, some simple calculations suggest that this could happen around 2027. Don't forget to tag me when we witness this historic moment in two years. I will not forget to mention you and some of the great members I have seen in the forum like LoyceV, NotATether, fillippone, AB de Royse777, Hhampuz, icopress, mprep, hilariousandco, theymos, DdmrDdmr, The Cryptovator, apogio, The Sceptical Chymist, OmegaStarScream, dkbit98, bitmover, hugeblack, philipma1957 and others to mention who might also be interested to know when the block finally hit 1 million in two years to come.

comments.author: nelson4lov
comments.body: I saw the news earlier from one of the news outlets and it just put a smile on my face. It's really interesting how far Bitcoin have come especially after we were heavily fudded that it won't last but we're celebrating block 888,888 milestone.Love to see it. I'll be here when we hit our first 1 million block as well.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: I am sure many will be interested in it and also the 1 million block. Anyway, I was checking the source you provided but it seems it isn't the block that you have mentioned but the block 888,878 which isn't the block 888,888. I was gonna say that it is mined by mara pool but I noticed that the blocked on the link that you provided is for block 888,878. I think there will be people who will celebrate about this many blocks being mined.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on March 23, 2025, 09:43:37 PMThank God (as a person who transacts in Bitcoin and not as a miner  ) the inscription madness died down sometime back.It's the first time I've seen mempool.space's block with actually images inside (in the OP, not on mempool.space). This makes it even more obvious what a BS it is to add shitty images to Bitcoin's blockchain. And to get in, transaction fees for this block went up 5-10 fold compared to other blocks around that time.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: What a unique significance in the bitcoin network, this is indeed a great milestone achievement and we are from here looking forward to 900,000 and then 1,000,000 block and i hope we all have the same reasons to be around here in celebrating them subsequently, bitcoin has been an amazing cryptocurrency and the same way we have this noble community as its number one reliable information source, see you all when we achieve more and have reasons to talk about this in the near future.

comments.author: Dailyscript
comments.body: Very exciting news to here. As a result of continuous adaption since the election period till date the block has increased significant. I wasn't expecting 888,888 by now. At the same time i know now that we should be expecting more blocks especially if the price dropped a little more. Many more years to us to witness how far Bitcoin can go. Am glad OP shared this information because i wanst aware of it.

comments.author: Josefjix
comments.body: What an I credible news to hear so far in the Bitcoin mining journey, it is one of the most unique block which looks like an angel number, lmaoI'm just waiting for a day the block shall reach a new milestone of 1m and above and it's going to be groundbreaking shocking news for everyone, just waiting for special day ahead.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Quote from: Dailyscript on March 24, 2025, 02:49:13 PM... I wasn't expecting 888,888 by now. ...Why you wasn't expeting? there is a strict control on block emission to avoid to mine fastest or latest blocks...with this block there was a nice fee for miners since people that tried to write in this block have just used... 12 sats/byte  now after few hundreds  of block is already 4 sats/byte ... I know this will not be really popular for people "inscribing", but I would love to pay always lower fees

comments.author: uche6215
comments.body: 8 is an even number in Mathematics and it is divided by 2 and there is no remaining or remainder. And bitcoin has come to hit 888,888. Op you deserve 8 from the this and and inform the community when the block hit 1 million milestone and that will be 10 merits. Those who are on the faith from the beginning have tried without deviating upon all the obstacles.

comments.author: BenCodie
comments.body: I'm not entirely for ordinals and the purpose they serve, though some of the inscriptions on block 888,888 are cool. Love the spaceblock and that inscribed PFP will be worth a lot. Quote from: nelson4lov on March 23, 2025, 10:58:19 PMI saw the news earlier from one of the news outlets and it just put a smile on my face. It's really interesting how far Bitcoin have come especially after we were heavily fudded that it won't last but we're celebrating block 888,888 milestone.Love to see it. I'll be here when we hit our first 1 million block as well. I'd like to hope that block 1,000,000 parties will be a reality in this not so distant future!

comments.author: betswift
comments.body: Love the BTCized Dog of Toby Fox in the inscriptions. Many more blocks to come.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Was looking at how blocks were moving  on mempool, I must say it was impressive to see how fast these were getting mined and was wondering if a fork happened recently  because not so long ago we could wait for not less than ~20 minutes to get a confirmation, but what am seeing is great work from our miners as the facilitate smooth running of the Bitcoin network.Nice Artwork btw
